thread.title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 7
thread.title_full: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 7 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 7
text:
Joe Johnston Joe Johnston Age: 57
Residence: West Ashley
Occupation: Retired city of Charleston firefighter
Education: High school
Political experience: None
Contact information: (843) 345-2477, westashleyjoe.com , and on Facebook at Joe Johnston for Charleston City Council
How I spend my spare time: I like to spend time with friends and ride my Harley.
What makes me qualified for this office: I am a longtime resident of West Ashley. I believe I can make a difference to the area with fresh and innovative ideas.
If elected, my top priority would be: West Ashley is being neglected. I will stand up for the area and hold developers and the city of Charleston accountable for their actions.
Keith Waring Age: 60
Residence: West Ashley
Occupation: Financial advisor and owner of financial planning firm
Education: Bachelor’s degree in banking and finance, University of South Carolina, licensed registered principal
Political experience: Charleston City Council member since 2011
Contact information: (843) 763-5388, Keith@KeithWaring.com , www.KeithWaring.com
How I spend my spare time: I spend quality time with family, sincere friends and fishing.
What makes me qualified for this office: I have served on City Council for 4 years. I serve on numerous community boards and on executive branches including the Charleston Metro Chamber of Commerce. Experience matters.
If elected, my top priority would be: Revitalization of West Ashley and Citadel Mall area. Beautification of main thoroughfares — Sam Rittenburg Boulevard, St. Andrews Boulevard and Savannah Highway. Complete Interstate 526. Comprehensive drainage plan for West Ashley. Housing Charlestonians can afford.
